metadata.title: CVE-2024-3860 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
An out-of-memory condition during object initialization could result in anempty shape list. If the JIT subsequently traced the object it would crash.This vulnerability affects Firefox < 125.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-3860` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 125.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
firefox-geckodriver - 125.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 125.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '125.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2').
thunderbird package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
